title: BBC Local Live: Sheffield and South Yorkshire on Tuesday 5 January 2016 - BBC News
summary: barnsley mp michael dugher sacked from shadow cabinet .
hillsborough inquests : jurors hear final evidence after almost two years .
two young children and six adults injured in barnsley crash .
all weekend football matches on sheffield council pitches cancelled .
calls to reduce speed limit after road death in sheffield .

documents.title: our live coverage for sheffield and south yorkshire has finished for the day
text: live updates for sheffield and south yorkshire are all over for today .
i 'll be back with you from 08:00 on wednesday 6 january with the latest news , sport , weather and travel updates from across the county .
author: Gemma Ashcroft
BBC Sheffield

documents.title: barnsley football fan banned for assaulting pc
text: a football fan who attacked a police officer during a match has been banned from football grounds for three years .
rhys atkinson , 23 , assaulted the officer during a match between chesterfield fc and barnsley fc , at the proact stadium , on 8 august .
he was fined £ 216 and ordered to pay £ 50 in compensation to the officer and £ 620 towards prosecution costs .
atkinson , of mansfield road , barnsley , pleaded guilty to assaulting a police officer at chesterfield justice centre .

documents.title: rare sheffield tree set for axe to be 'reassessed '
text: a rare elm tree set for the axe will be 'reassessed ' after a public protest , sheffield council has confirmed .
around 100 people rallied by the tree at the junction of chelsea road and union road in nether edge on saturday in a bid to save it from felling .
author: Sheffield Star

documents.title: weather update : cloudy overnight with outbreaks of showery rain
text: cloudy with outbreaks of showery rain , heavy in places at first this evening but tending to become lighter by wednesday morning .
it 'll be foggy across the hills .
author: Kay Crewdson
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: latest headlines : barnsley mp says he was sacked for speaking out and evidence at the hillsborough inquest concludes after almost two years
text: latest headlines : barnsley mp says he was sacked for speaking out and evidence at the hillsborough inquest concludes after almost two years
author: Jenny Cork
BBC Sheffield, Local Live

documents.title: doncaster council criticises 'major failure ' over homeless teenager 's treatment
text: members of doncaster council 's cabinet have said there was `` a major failure '' in how a homeless 16-year-old girl was dealt with by authorities .

last month , the local government ombudsman ( lgo ) gave a verdict of maladministration after the teenager was not properly assessed by social workers at doncaster children 's services trust , an independent body set up in october 2014 .
cabinet member joe blackham said at a meeting this morning that the mayor and cabinet only found out about the case after the lgo had given its verdict .
the cabinet member for children , young people and schools , nuala fennelly , said in a statement :

i am very disappointed that important lessons regarding the provision of accommodation for young people in need were not learned and i have made clear to the management of the relevant organisations involved in this case that what happened is not acceptable .
author: Kevin Larkin, Doncaster reporter, BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: hillsborough inquests : jurors finish hearing almost two years of evidence
text: the jurors at the hillsborough inquests have finished hearing evidence after nearly two years .

today they heard medical opinion about the deaths of six people including tony bland , who died nearly four years after the disaster , and james aspinall , whose mother margaret campaigns for hillsborough families .
the court will now break for three weeks after which the coroner , sir john goldring , will sum up the evidence which has been heard .
the jurors are expected to begin their deliberations at the end of february .
author: Judith Moritz
BBC North of England Correspondent

documents.title: two young children among eight injured in pile-up near barnsley
text: a four-year-old girl suffered life-threatening injuries and a three-year-old boy was seriously injured when three cars were involved in a crash at hoylandswaine near barnsley yesterday evening , police have said .
the children were in a vauxhall corsa travelling on barnsley road towards silkstone when it collided head-on with a peugeot 107 which then hit a ford mondeo .
the corsa driver , a 36-year-old man and his 21-year-old male passenger , both from penistone , also suffered serious injuries .
a passenger in the peugeot , a 49-year-old man from barnsley , also suffered life-threatening injuries .
the driver , a 50-year-old woman from barnsley , suffered minor injuries .
two women in the mondeo also escaped with minor injuries .
author: Gemma Ashcroft
BBC Sheffield

documents.title: latest headlines : angela smith mp says the latest labour reshuffle shows divisions in the party and police divers are searching askern lake in doncaster
text: latest headlines : angela smith mp says the latest labour reshuffle shows divisions in the party and police divers are searching askern lake in doncaster
author: Gina Bolton
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: askern triple death crash : divers carry out lake search
text: divers from south yorkshire police have searched askern lake as part of the investigation into a crash which killed three people .
andrew and fay tomlinson and their friend mandy deere were killed in a collision on boxing day which has left mandy 's husband john in a critical condition in hospital .

twenty-four-year old ricky joe hepworth , of newmarche drive in askern , has been charged with a number of driving offences , including three counts of causing death by dangerous driving , and is due to appear at sheffield crown court later this month .
author: Kevin Larkin, Doncaster reporter, BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: all football matches on sheffield city council parks playing fields cancelled this weekend
text: recent heavy rain and the forecast of more on the way has stopped play for all local football fixtures planned for this weekend at all sheffield city council parks playing fields .
the weather means council officers are unable to mark out pitches on waterlogged ground for scheduled league matches .
it is hoped that fixtures planned for the following weekend will go ahead if the weather improves .
author: Gina Bolton
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: watch : sheffield shop manager sadie tells us who her everyday hero is
text: i 've been asking people today who their everyday hero is .
sadie runs the cancer research shop on pinstone street in sheffield .
this is what she had to say about the volunteers who work with her :
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Radio Sheffield reporter

documents.title: weather update : patchy rain for the rest of the day
text: showery rain continuing for the rest of the day .
remaining cloudy with some mist and fog forming across rural parts .
a much better day expected tomorrow , remaining cloudy but with more in the way of brightness and sunny spells .
a drier day with a few showers and highs of 6c
author: Owain Wyn Evans
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: calls to reduce speed limit after road death in sheffield
text: more than 2,000 people have signed a petition to reduce the speed limit and improve safety on a road where a 20-year-old man died in a crash .
sean salvin , from sheffield , died on 30 december when his red volkswagen golf crashed on ecclesfield road , in an area known as woolley wood bottom .
the petition urges the council to cut the speed limit from 60mph to 40mph .
sheffield city council said it would not comment on the petition due to an ongoing police investigation .
author: Oliver Wright

documents.title: sheffield bus gate and lane fines net council nearly £ 1m
text: motorists in sheffield have been hit by almost £ 1m in fines in less than a year for driving in bus lanes and through bus gates .
author: Sheffield Star

documents.title: rotherham united to extend farrend rawson 's youth loan
text: andy giddings
gids1980
# rufc have agreed to extend farrend rawson 's youth loan from # dcfc until the end of season .
# rufc have agreed to extend farrend rawson 's youth loan from # dcfc until the end of season .

documents.title: sheffield artists create the 'mind of john ruskin ' using entire oak tree
text: i 've been to chatting local artists mir jansen and henk littlewood who have recreated the 'mind of john ruskin ' in wood in gouache for the millennium gallery in sheffield .
and here it is in all it 's glory .
an entire oak tree was donated by the companions of st.george ( ruskin trust ) from their forest in the wyre valley .
author: Mick Lunney
BBC Radio Sheffield reporter

documents.title: sheffield council not planning to open up empty buildings to homeless
text: a petition has been signed by more than 5,500 people calling for sheffield 's empty buildings to be offered to those sleeping on the streets .
it 's after a similar scheme in manchester where gary neville gave permission for squatters to stay in a hotel he 's doing up until february .
i am committed to doing everything possible to help people who are homeless or at risk of becoming so .
this includes providing accommodation to anyone forced to sleep on the street in sheffield during severe winter weather .
and because we 're able to meet the need for this , we 're not currently planning to open up empty buildings '' .
the petition will be debated at a full council meeting tomorrow .
author: Gemma Ashcroft
BBC Sheffield

documents.title: sheffield 's children 's hospital to honour its staff and volunteers
text: the children 's hospital in sheffield is looking for your help to honour its staff and volunteers .
from today you can vote for what 's been called the children 's star awards .
it 's for people you think help provide outstanding care for the children of sheffield .
you can nominate someone here .

documents.title: health alert : watch out for symptoms of norovirus
text: members of the public have been warned to be on the lookout for symptoms of norovirus and take sensible precautions in case you suffer a bout this winter .
norovirus , sometimes known as the 'winter vomiting disease ' because it usually occurs during the winter months , often starts to appear in the autumn peaking during january .
author: Sheffield Star

documents.title: latest headlines : barnsley mp michael dugher sacked from shadow cabinet and calls for council to open empty buildings rejected
text: latest headlines : barnsley mp michael dugher sacked from shadow cabinet and calls for council to open empty buildings rejected
author: Gina Bolton
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: michael dugher a 'rare and talented politician ' - labour deputy leader
text: labour 's deputy leader tom watson has spoken out in praise of barnsley east mp michael dugher , who has been axed as shadow culture secretary by leader jeremy corbyn .
he said :
michael dugher is a rare politician - a talented working class mp who has n't lost his strong yorkshire roots .
politicians with his ability and commitment can make a difference in any role .
labour 's loss in the shadow cabinet will be compensated by michael 's free thought on the backbenches . ''

documents.title: update : barnsley mp michael dugher was sacked from shadow cabinet for 'things he 'd been writing '
text: the barnsley east mp has become the first casualty of labour leader jeremy corbyn 's shadow cabinet reshuffle as he was sacked from the post of shadow culture secretary .
michael dugher has told the bbc that jeremy corbyn told him he did n't like the things that he 'd been writing .
while mr dugher said that he had to speak out in defence of colleagues who were being briefed against .
author: BBC Politics

documents.title: hundreds of people sign safety petition after fatal crash
text: heartbroken relatives of a sheffield man killed in a crash on a flooded sheffield road are calling for safety improvements to prevent more deaths .
sean salvin , aged 20 , was driving along ecclesfield road , wooley wood bottom , in heavy rain when his lost control of his volkswagen golf and crashed into a tree .
author: Sheffield Star

documents.title: firefighters open fitness gym with a difference in sheffield
text: two firefighters from sheffield have set up their own gym - with exercise inspired by what they get up to at work .
mick lunney
micklunney
fitness firefighter-style at a new gym in halfway @ twitterid @ twitterid
fitness firefighter-style at a new gym in halfway @ twitterid @ twitterid

documents.title: thousands sign petition to open up sheffield 's empty buildings to homeless
text: a petition has been signed by 5,600 people calling for sheffield 's empty buildings to be opened up to the homeless over winter .
it 's after a similar scheme in manchester where footballer gary neville gave permission for squatters to stay in a hotel he 's doing up until february .
it will be debated at full council tomorrow at the town hall .

documents.title: persistent rain causing new large potholes to open across south yorkshire

documents.title: latest headlines : nearly 6,000 sign petition in sheffield calling for empty buildings to be opened for homeless and recent persistent rain is damaging local roads
text: the top stories in south yorkshire so far this morning include :
author: Everard Davy
BBC Radio Sheffield News

documents.title: rotherham abuse trial : full list of defendants
text: more on the trial at sheffield crown court of five men and two women accused over the sexual abuse of children in rotherham over a period of about 10 years .
the defendants on trial are :

documents.title: rotherham sex abuse trial : mother weeps at daughter 's 'abuse ' book
text: a mother wept in court as she recalled finding a school exercise book her daughter had used to record a string of alleged sexual offences against her .
she said she had been left `` shocked '' by the `` explicit '' text in which her daughter said she was being abused by asian men .
the woman was giving evidence at the rotherham child sexual abuse trial at sheffield crown court yesterday .
five men and two women deny a range of charges related to alleged child abuse in the town over a 10-year period .
the trial continues .

documents.title: weather : grey , cloudy with showers
text: it 'll be another wet , cloudy day for sheffield and south yorkshire .
patchy rain expected throughout the day with highs of 8c .
watch my full forecast for today below
author: Owain Wyn Evans
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live coverage
text: i 'm with you until 18:00 tonight with your updates for sheffield and south yorkshire .
if you 've got a story got a you 'd like to share - why not get in touch over email , facebook or twitter like keith bown did and you could see your photo at the top of the page .
author: Gemma Ashcroft
BBC Sheffield
